nodes.bodyText: Could this or toLonLatStrings be changed so the NullPointerException thrown from either of these methods instead of the other constructor when value is null.
Put null checking in method at the first place.
nit: Could this be renamed dash to more closely follow the - character's name.

Should make sure the constructor and this method follow the same pattern around ensuring the internal values list isn't mutable. Right now the constructor will clone the list, effectively a deep clone based on how Strings work, ensuring it is immutable if the original list changes but this will return a reference to the internal list that could be mutated.
Good point. Will deep clone the list.
Could you add some tests which target this class specifically without call to the service.

I have added several test cases in SearchSyncTests.
Will add more for  unit testing ScoringParameter only
Should this just be Objects.requireNonNull, if null is returned here it will eventually lead to a NullPointerException in another, less obvious, location.
switch to null pointer exception check.

Why do we need to repeat creating flattenValue? This could be simplified to the following:
return name + SEPARATOR + flattenValue;
